identificationModule.briefTitle: Prospective Evaluation of Neurocognition in Patients Undergoing Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement
identificationModule.officialTitle: Prospective Evaluation of Neurocognition in Patients Undergoing Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement: Periprocedural Changes and Predictors of Improvement

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This trail is for patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) who are receiving a transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR). We will assess changes in neurocognition following TAVR with the 5 minute Montreal Cognitive Assessment (mini MoCA) when comparing pre procedure with post procedure assessments.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Patients with mild cognitive impairment who are being treated with a TAVR can choose to take part in this trial. This trial will prospectively enroll patients at 4 Baylor Scott \& White facilities. 80 patients will be enrolled between all sites. The mini MoCA will be conducted at the following time points: pre TAVR, 30 days post TAVR, and 6 months post TAVR. All other data will be collected from patient charts and are considered standard part of their care.

armGroups.label: Patients with Mild Cognitive Impairment Undergoing TAVR
armGroups.description: Patients will be treated with standard of care. In addition, patients will complete the mini MoCA at 3 time points
interventionNames: Other: 5 minute Montreal Cognitive Assessment (mini MoCA)

interventions.name: 5 minute Montreal Cognitive Assessment (mini MoCA)
interventions.description: The mini MoCA will be completed by the patient before TAVR, and 30 days and 6 months after TAVR
armGroupLabels: Patients with Mild Cognitive Impairment Undergoing TAVR

primaryOutcomes.measure: Neurocognition measured by Mini MoCA at 30 days post TAVR
primaryOutcomes.description: Changes in neurocognition compared to baseline at 30 days

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Neurocognition measured by Mini MoCA at 6 months post TAVR
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in neurocognition compared to baseline at 6 months

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Age 18 years or older
2. Undergoing a TAVR procedure
3. Possible MCI as determined by procedures already used in the TAVR clinics, including 1 of the 4:

   1. MMSE \< 27
   2. History of MCI, dementia, or stroke (CVA or TIA)
   3. History of prescription treatment for MCI
   4. Discretion of the investigator, physician, or clinic staff
4. Scores 25 or less on the mini MoCA exam

Exclusion Criteria:

1. In another research study that doesn't allow dual enrolment, or dual enrolment has not been granted.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients undergoing TAVR with mild cognitive impairment
